availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Solomon B. Bennett (Wayne County, Tennessee, farm laborer and soldier)

body.p: Wayne County, Tennessee, farm laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Married to Sarah Ann Minor Bennett in Wayne County, Tennessee, on March 25, 1858. Resident of Wayne County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farm laborer in Wayne County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and quartermaster sergeant from December 15, 1863, to July 19, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Wayne County, District 12, p. 300A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Wayne County, District 11, p. 273.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0105.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Wayne County, 1857-1929: Marriages 3, p. 6-7.
